displaytitle: Ceremonial ensemble for n’anga (diviner) and timhamba (divination implements)
medium: Fiber, olive shells, cowrie shells, bone (unidentified), seed pods, wood, fat, animal hair, ceramic, glass beads, cloth, ochre, metal, feather (possibly purple-crested turaco), porcupine quill, brass wire, copper wire, grass, copper, aluminum, nylon fishing wire, vulture beak, leather, wild orange fruit, clay, gourd, wool, buttons, enamel paint, mirror, plastic, mastic, and seeds
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund

titles.title: Ceremonial ensemble for n’anga (diviner) and timhamba (divination implements)

texts.textentryhtml: Owner unrecorded, Gaba, Limpopo Province, South Africa, before 1988; purchased by Alex Zaloumis, South Africa, 1988; [purchased by Axis Gallery, West Orange, NJ, 2004]; purchased by the Princeton University Art Museum, Princeton, NJ, 2024.

geography.displaygeography: Place made: Africa, South Africa, Limpopo Province, Gaba

caption: Artist unrecorded, Tsonga, Gaba, Limpopo Province, South Africa, Ceremonial ensemble for n’anga (diviner) and timhamba (divination implements), ca. 1960–70. Fiber, olive shells, cowrie shells, bone (unidentified), seed pods, wood, fat, animal hair, ceramic, glass beads, cloth, ochre, metal, feather (possibly purple-crested turaco), porcupine quill, brass wire, copper wire, grass, copper, aluminum, nylon fishing wire, vulture beak, leather, wild orange fruit, clay, gourd, wool, buttons, enamel paint, mirror, plastic, mastic, and seeds. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2024-120.1-.47)
